website_summaries.verdict: Grippy, toeless socks that let you keep your balance as you move through your poses. They're one-size-fits-most, and some users say they run small.
pros: Help with grip, warmth and comfort practicing yoga on hard surfaces
Open toe design makes it easier to maintain balance
Thin fabric makes them comfortable for hot yoga, and protects feet from sweat after class
One sizes fits most, many patterns available
cons: Some say they run small, but they do stretch a bit

customer_reviews.title: great yoga socks!
customer_reviews.text: These socks are super great for yoga. My husband asked me what I needed yoga socks for and I will tell you exactly what I told him: a. if your feet get cold in yoga, especially if you are doing slower forms, these will keep your feet warmer b. because the toes are free, you still get the stability of being without socks and having your toes avaialble for good balance c. the grippers on the bottom keep you from slipping like you would if you just wore regular socks to yoga to sum up: I love these socks, they are super comfy, wash up well, and the colors are very fun!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Winter Pedicure Socks
customer_reviews.text: I love yoga and practice regularly. However, I can't imagine these socks would work all that well for that purpose. I do love these for an 'off label' use. These are perfect for winter pedicures. Soak your feet, scrub, and moisturize before putting the socks on. They'll keep the moisture in and keep your feet warm, all while freeing your toes to be painted!
customer_reviews.author: priusapril

customer_reviews.title: They do the trick when traveling!
customer_reviews.text: I typically do yoga at home on my sticky mat, but when I travel without my mat, I use these for extra grip and protection from germs on the studio's mats. I have women's size 10 feet and these fit fine in the length but the toes are a little tight - nothing too uncomfortable but when the socks get bunched up during the course of a class, I notice it. They wash easily in a hotel sink and dry overnight. Glad to have these tucked into my suitcase!
customer_reviews.author: Cottage Cheese

customer_reviews.title: Ouch
customer_reviews.text: These socks were made too small in the toe area. The openings are for someone with baby toes. You can eventually get your toes in after much work, but they pinch and in yoga poses they cut into the toe joint area. Very uncomfortable. I have bought toeless socks before and they were not this uncomfortable. Gaiam supplier built these for tiny asian person I think. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I have small feet, size 6. These are so small. The holes for the toes are too small. The elastic around the ankle is too tight. I have small ankles. On the other hand, they are very well made, just can’t wear~ too small.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yoga Socks: Not sure it was the right purchase for me
customer_reviews.text: Have seen quite a few people in my yoga and barre classes wearing so purchased a few pairs. They are comfortable once I get on. My only issues is the toe part. It is very hard to get toes into the toe holes without spending several minutes doing this. For me it wasn’t to best design choice, but that doesn’t mean it won’t work for you.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Good grip, very small toe openings
customer_reviews.text: I like the traction afforded by these socks, but the toe openings on the black ones I ordered are very small. It makes them difficult to put on (especially in the dim light of my yoga studio), and very uncomfortable due to the tightness around each toe. I don't have large feet or toes, so I was surprised and disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: tamgib

customer_reviews.title: Great for yoga!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my sister for Christmas. She's always been a fan of both toe and toeless socks but really wanted a pair like these for when she does Yoga. She's a certified yoga instructor and absolutely loves wearing these when she's working out. They both comfortable and provide great traction. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Ehimmelman

customer_reviews.title: NOT as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a medium, only to get a small/medium stating it will fit women's shoe size 5-10. Wrong. These are awful and hurt like crazy before I stood up! There is NOOOOOOOO way that someone with a size 5 can wear the same sock as that of a size 10. These are clearly mass produced, of debatable quality and definitely not worth a cent. Spend the extra $ and get the real deal. This is not it.
customer_reviews.author: SASSYANG

customer_reviews.title: Toe holes a bit small, and not very stretchy
customer_reviews.text: Put them on at home and don't be late for class because these are slow to get on. Others of the same style are not. Once on they're great. I use them for Pilates, not for yoga. For yoga, I go barefoot.
customer_reviews.author: rs

customer_reviews.title: what was I doing with my life before these?
customer_reviews.text: These are GREAT. My feet get a little clammy especially when I'm doing a really muscle-focused yoga flow. These are a GAME CHANGER, I'm no longer sliding and readjusting during yoga. They DO get a little tight on your toes during lunges and warrior poses but honestly the good outweigh the bad.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Marble

customer_reviews.title: they were SUPER uncomfortable from the moment I began my hot yoga ...
customer_reviews.text: I would return these if I could. While they worked OK when I wore them to a trial Pilates reformer class, they were SUPER uncomfortable from the moment I began my hot yoga class. During a standard set of asanas, the toe 'holes' twist and contort such that it felt as if it were cutting off circulation to my toes. I took them OFF after 1/4 of the class. These were a total disaster.
customer_reviews.author: B.D.

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and good quality yoga/workout socks
customer_reviews.text: The socks fit perfectly to me I have a shoe size of 5 - 5.5. These socks are best for small shoe size persons. The material is a bit thick for a $9.99 socks w/c is a good thing. The sticky part grip so well against my yoga matt so I don't have to worry about sliding off.
customer_reviews.author: Mar

customer_reviews.title: Actually pretty comfy.
customer_reviews.text: They are a cute color and the colors shown. They went over my toes nicely and the two little toes have slightly more coverage, but I don’t mind that because I don’t like feeling like those little guys are getting their circulation cut off.
customer_reviews.author: Heideh Sohi

customer_reviews.title: Gets painful about halfway through class.
customer_reviews.text: These are cute. I like using them for yoga, but about halfway through the class, I have to adjust them because it gets too tight between my toes (and it's pretty painful). So I don't use them as much as I wanted to.
customer_reviews.author: J.J.

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan of these
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a fan of these. I get the concept and they do grip the mat, but these feel loose on my feet and it feels like my foot is slipping in certain poses because they are moving inside the sock. I found I prefer my bare feet and because I work out at home... I don't really have to worry about covering them.
customer_reviews.author: Scout

customer_reviews.title: So cute and chic
customer_reviews.text: I love these yoga socks. Can wait til we’re more comfortable going back out so other people can see these. I no longer slip on my yoga mat when doing downward dog.
customer_reviews.author: jgurl

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Felt tight on some of piggys after wearing an hour or so, and a little bit of work to get each toe in the hole. Hopefully after a few more wears they'll stretch. I appreciate the non slip bottom however, this was very good.
customer_reviews.author: E. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: My feet are a size 7 and I ordered a small, but the material of the socks is very thin and when you do standing positions with your legs stretched far apart (think the warrior poses), your feet slide inside the socks. I ended up having to pull them off in the middle of a position.
customer_reviews.author: Tita Sokoloff

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: As described. Good price. The pair are exactly the same except different skid colors on the bottom. If you lose one, you can always use one from the other pair. I use these for Barre, as we are on the exercise room with bare feet. They do the job, and works well at the barre as well so you don't slide if you are holding on and squatting. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: LAUREN F

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The rubber on the bottom came out and it becomes regular socks
customer_reviews.author: foot3ch

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: They pinch your toes until they are sufficiently stretched out, which take a while.
customer_reviews.author: N. M.

customer_reviews.title: A Touch Snug
customer_reviews.text: As an open toed sock goes, they're fine. I found the pinky toe a bit too high and the sock a bit snug, but nothing so bad as to make it unwearable. Otherwise, all good.
customer_reviews.author: OpinePartyof1

customer_reviews.title: Breathable with great grip!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve recently started Pilates and these socks work great! I was worried about thickness but they are perfect. Breathable yet sturdy for barre work. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica S

customer_reviews.title: IT'S PERFECT lol. The grips are very good I don't ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't use it for yoga AT ALL, I actually purchase these to moisturize my feet after a pedicure and still be able to paint my nails without worrying about them getting damaged. IT'S PERFECT lol. The grips are very good I don't slip which does tend to happen when you moisturize your feet with other socks. I can see these helping you maintain balance in Yoga.
customer_reviews.author: Dalia Susana

customer_reviews.title: Great Function, Questionable Quality
customer_reviews.text: These socks work very well for their intended purpose - my feet stay firmly in place while doing yoga, whereas before I started wearing the socks, I'd slide all over my mat. However, after only one use and wash, one of the socks came out of the dryer with a hole in it. I'm pretty disappointed, because I love the way the socks fit, and they do work well to avoid slippage on a yoga mat. I'm hoping it was a fluke, because the other three socks (from a pack of two pairs) seem to be doing okay.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Burberry-Martin

customer_reviews.title: Good yoga sock
customer_reviews.text: The toes aren’t bad but can feel a little restrictive after a while. Could have better grip, but pretty good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gift for mum, she's pleased.
customer_reviews.text: My mum has been attending the yoga classes offered in a drafty local gymnasium and when asked, she wanted yoga socks. Out of the socks I've gotten for her, she said she wore these the most; they were comfortable and warm enough without making her feet sweaty. As she's rather picky about socks, I'd consider that a glowing review.
customer_reviews.author: Allison D

customer_reviews.title: I'm a size 5. 5-6 women's shoe. These ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a size 5.5-6 women's shoe. These were slightly big on me (heel was loose), but nothing that got in the way of use. Looks exactly as pictured and fits the toes well, though I personally am not a fan of the toeless style over just regular grip socks. They take a long time to put on and you have to fuss with them in the laundry.
customer_reviews.author: JHL

customer_reviews.title: Size 8 Fit Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size 8-8.5 show depending on the brand, and these socks fit perfectly. I was afraid they would be too small, but took the risk which ended up paying off greatly. Not only do they fit well, but they're ridiculously comfortable and are true to their "no slip" name. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby C

customer_reviews.title: love the toeless shoes
customer_reviews.text: These were a great Christmas present for my daughter. She loves to do yoga and sometimes the yoga class is a little cold so these come in handy. She loves that her toes stick out and everyone can see that she's wearing nail polish and funky colors. The size is great and if you can make a 15-year-old girl happy they must be pretty good
customer_reviews.author: Adi

customer_reviews.title: Gaiam Grippy Toeless Yoga Socks
customer_reviews.text: Gaiam Grippy Toeless Yoga Socks seem to have been made for me. I have a bunion and my larger toe wanted to cross over the second toe. These socks keep that from happening. I think I would still wear them even if I didn't have the bunion.
customer_reviews.author: C. Clemons

customer_reviews.title: Cute, not useful for me.
customer_reviews.text: I do not prefer these soxs as the toe openings enlarge with wear becoming uncomfortable to me.
customer_reviews.author: Annita Yamasaki

customer_reviews.title: Will definitely keep buying more
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect. Very strong grip and comfortable. The colors were prettier than the photos. I got 2 just to try them but I will buy more now. They fit really well and I have wide feet. They are perfect for yoga.
customer_reviews.author: adriana gorczyca

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: Gave 4 rating only due to being to small so I never got to wear them, gave them to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Sky Blue

customer_reviews.title: Skimpy with the fabric
customer_reviews.text: These barely fit over my size 10 feet. If they're going to be so skimpy with the fabric, they need to make a size L.
customer_reviews.author: JanoDrano

customer_reviews.title: Keep my feet where I need them to be
customer_reviews.text: Love my toeless socks. Use em at yoga class. Very helpful on mat, as these socks keep my feet exactly where I need them to be, and no slipping. So far so good. I wash them with my load of laundry machine wash warm, then hang dry.
customer_reviews.author: GamieTiaBettita

customer_reviews.title: Functional and attractive
customer_reviews.text: My yoga studio requires grippy socks and charges $16, so I was thankful to find these on amazon for only $9 (free shipping too, thank you amazon prime). I was skeptic at first about all the fabric in between my toes, but i prefer this design since it also helps me from sliding around. Also, the fabric is much thinner than a typical athletic sock, so the extra stuff between my toes is not noticeable. The socks also look nice. The swirly turquiose grippers on the bottom are fun.
customer_reviews.author: SarDoug

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for yoga
customer_reviews.text: I love these but after wearing yoga socks with the toes in them I had issues with those being to big so I ordered these in a small. I wear a 6.5 shoe and I struggle getting these on my toes. I will try the larger size next time.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Great color, fit and comfort. Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Fit great, look great, very sticky and great for pilates and the like! Will buy again as more colors become available!
customer_reviews.author: Aunty

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy
customer_reviews.text: Love these yogo socks. I don't like getting my feet dirty so I wear these around my house all day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. They fit well and are relatively easy to put on. Thanks, Gaiam!
customer_reviews.author: dcmimi

customer_reviews.title: Great yoga socks
customer_reviews.text: I love these! They're my first pair of toe socks, I wasn't sure if I'd like them but they're awesome. They allow me to keep my toes spread and my feet stable during yoga, and the non slip soles extend from the back of the heel all the way to the toes. Plus, really cute and fun to wear!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Cute but toe socks are not the most comfortable
customer_reviews.text: They are cute but cut deep between my toes when they stretch
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Dimi

customer_reviews.title: Lot of traction but not good for bigger toes
customer_reviews.text: Loved the traction and design, but it cut off circulation to my toes. I cut out some of the toe spacers, which helped for a while, but now it is starting to slip. If you have slender toes it should work great for you. I use it for yoga on carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfcub

customer_reviews.title: Don't wash in machine!!
customer_reviews.text: Although I love how they look and feel, I washed them once, now each one has a hole in it. Bummer! Definitely not worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: MDavid

customer_reviews.title: Work better and held up longer than my Toe socks brand toe socks.
customer_reviews.text: These are a repeat purchase. They held up better and were more grippy than my Toe Socks brand grip socks. I use them in Pilates. The timeless version are better for Pilates than those w toes.
customer_reviews.author: LA Helmut Lang gal

customer_reviews.title: kind of uncomfortable with the toes but I'm sure they work fine once i wear
customer_reviews.text: Never got a chance to wear, kind of uncomfortable with the toes but I'm sure they work fine once i wear them
customer_reviews.author: Ariella

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: So cozy and works great during yoga. Quality is nice too. I also feel like my feet are cleaner walking on the sometimes dirty yoga room floor of you know what I mean (after hot yoga). Lol
customer_reviews.author: Peace Joy Love

customer_reviews.title: Fit fine and are comphy
customer_reviews.text: Love these, use them in the summer for running around in the house and can throw on flip flops to take the dog out. They are also great for doing my physical therapy, too.
customer_reviews.author: shortcake

customer_reviews.title: a good product for when you're on the road
customer_reviews.text: I really love taking these socks on the road with em when i can't take my yoga mat. it takes a couple time to get used to it, but you won't slip even on carpet floors. The cotton is light enough that it won't make your feet sweat. They also look pretty cute.
customer_reviews.author: Pcc

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Grip!!
customer_reviews.text: These are great yoga socks!!! They are extremely grippy so you won't slip. I bought these socks because my feet sweat when I do yoga, pi-yo, and barre classes. These socks work well for all three classes.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Missing toe holes.
customer_reviews.text: The pair I got were poorly made: several of the toe holes were non-existent/still seemed sewn together. I had to open them myself.
customer_reviews.author: theboxesofcotton

customer_reviews.title: Great fit.
customer_reviews.text: These yoga socks rock! I generally enjoy my yoga and lifting barefoot, but don’t like sweating all over the place with my feet. Thus these socks are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: Great toeless socks
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several brands of toeless socks and I do like the color (gray) and the comfort (soft and stretchy). I think this one is my favorite as I wear it pretty much everywhere - at home and when I go out (it matches most of my outfits). Due to medical reasons, it is best to keep my feet protected. When people ask about them, I tell them they are great for circulation and to check them out on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: L. Jong

customer_reviews.title: The only asana that they are good for is Tadasana
customer_reviews.text: I am a yoga instructor. I tried these socks out in my yoga class and wore them for 15 minutes. The only asana that they are good for is Tadasana. They do not slip on the mat, good thing, but your feet slip within the socks. I had the correct size, but felt very unstable wearing them. I would not recommend them. Get a good mat.
customer_reviews.author: j.o.

customer_reviews.title: I like these. Takes getting used to
customer_reviews.text: I like these. Takes getting used to, having toes exposed. They serve the purpose if you don’t like walking barefoot on the yoga floor. They have good traction grip for running warm ups in kickboxing.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Grippy sock but...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for yoga and barre work outs. I like the sock perse and the grippiness is good but the individual toe holes seem to pull and strain when you are holding posses. It was a little uncomfortable for my little piggies and I haven't worn them since. I will try again before I lump in the "waste of money purchase" pile. Regular grippy socks won't work and I like my toes on the mat.
customer_reviews.author: Scream Queen

customer_reviews.title: Alright
customer_reviews.text: These are alright. They serve their purpose just fine. But I received two right foot socks so when I put my left foot in, the hole is real tight cutting off my circulation. I don't want to cut the hole and risk making it worse.
customer_reviews.author: keke dennis

customer_reviews.title: Tight toes
customer_reviews.text: A little snug around the toes for the first few times worn but then fine
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Only if you are used to toe products
customer_reviews.text: Not as comfortable as I would have liked. Didn't think about my foot movements, so some discomfort between my toes during the practice.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara H

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: Love my new yoga socks! Really nice gripping on the bottom, just was sad when a thread came out on the first use during yoga sculpt :( I just tucked it back in...I’m sure they’ll last me a little while longer...
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Good Fit / Occasional Foot Wedgie
customer_reviews.text: They are comfortable to wear and easy to clean. I am a women's shoe size 8.5-9 and find that these fit well. My only complaint is that while the outside grips do not slide, the inside can shift slightly against my foot. So besides the occasional "foot wedgie," it is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Fits great
customer_reviews.text: These fit my feet perfectly, and I like that the non-slip texture along the bottoms keep my feet from slipping. These yoga socks also keep my feet warm while walking around the house, without causing my toes to sweat (which regular socks do).
customer_reviews.author: MamaBear007

customer_reviews.title: Better than a yoga towel!
customer_reviews.text: In Hot Yoga I've tried different yoga mats and different yoga towels but this is beats them all! Keeps my feet in place through all the sweat! And now I just sanitize my mat, and only have to wash the socks, instead of a big (wet from sweat) towel. I've already recommended to others in the class. Now if they would just make yoga gloves. . .(hint hint)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: This sock is of poor quality in both material and durability. The sock is not soft and smooth. The material that was used is subpar. The threading around the toes is uncomfortable. The socks will not last long and will stain easy.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Staton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grips!
customer_reviews.text: These are actually my favorite pair of grip socks..they may not be fancy but the grips on this pair are the best in pilates class!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great grip for you feet on a yoga mat.
customer_reviews.text: Really like these socks. They were a bit to small, but I feel like they will stretch with use. Great grip for my feet on the yoga mat.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, fits as expected
customer_reviews.text: Nice socks. They fit perfectly (small size for size 8) Very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Comfy stability
customer_reviews.text: These are so comfy and they make my workouts even better with the grip that they give. I think I’ll buy more for me and my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Kasi Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: sox for pilates
customer_reviews.text: I like these socks when doing pilates but they won't work in shoes. You must take them off before putting on shoes as the material between the toes gets really jammed up in between your toes so that it hurts to wear them (due to the non-stick surface -it keeps the socks from sliding to the end of the shoe). It is winter here 8 months of the year so I have to bring them with, and change into them before a session which I think is a pain.
customer_reviews.author: KBar

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable !!!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love.... They are amazing and I will buy more. Will give a 5 star after first wash...
customer_reviews.author: LSUTIGER

customer_reviews.title: I love these socks
customer_reviews.text: I love these socks! I wear them around the house all the time. They are so comfortable, and having all hardwood floors in my house the grips are great even when I'm not doing yoga!
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and fast service. Very satisfied. Accurate description of item. Very nice experience.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Cute and effective
customer_reviews.text: I have a clean feet thing. They can't be dirty and I get nervous about fungus foot or something like that, so I wore these to yoga. The instructor said I needed to be barefoot but I don't think so, not the way people sweat on those floors. Ick. These are just the ticket. They're fashionable and slip-resistent.
customer_reviews.author: Diamond Girl

customer_reviews.title: Hurt my toes
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this type of sock for yoga. I tried them and they hurt to wear. Go with toeless or full toe coverage.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Gaynor

customer_reviews.title: Good. But minor flaw.
customer_reviews.text: Toe holes could be a touch wider. As they pull doing positions like downward dog can cut circulation off.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Good Grip
customer_reviews.text: These are good for helping you stick to the mat for Yoga when barefoot was a bit slippery especially after working up a bit of a sweat. I was a little disappointed because I thought it was suppose to be two pair according to the description when I first ordered. I would still recommend them as a good helpful purchase and reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Gave them as a gift to my daughter. She found them uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: i was a little worried about the feeling of the individual toe spaces, because i have never liked the "toe sock" feeling. but they are extremely comfortable & i don't even notice when i am practicing. the socks don't keep your feet too warm either & are absolutely lovely. i'm very glad i made the purchase & i highly recommend for anyone who may need a little extra grip! =)
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Hate these.
customer_reviews.text: It's not due to lack of quality. They seem fine. I just don't like how I get toe wedgies during yoga with them.
customer_reviews.author: Norma Martinez

customer_reviews.title: cute and made me feel somewhat better about walking around with no shoes at the gym
customer_reviews.text: cute and made me feel somewhat better about walking around with no shoes at the gym. Hoping that I'm not picking up someone elses germs.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Yu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for barre classes!
customer_reviews.text: I love these. Not gonna lie - I was a bit frustrated at the necessity of spending $12 on a pair of socks for my barre classes. If you're going to spend the money, though - buy these. They're nice and tight on the arch, so they don't slip around. No more falling out of prana because your socks are too loose. Love 'em. I'd buy 'em again. Heck, I probably will.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: The grip worked great, and you wouldn't know how much you need ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for doing yoga while travelling, so I wouldn't have to put my bare feet on yucky hotel room floors. The grip worked great, and you wouldn't know how much you need your toes for stretching until you use these. Loved these so much I bought a pair for my sister in law!
customer_reviews.author: abausch

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy the toeless because solid socks tug on my toes ...
customer_reviews.text: socks wash well and hold up in Barre/Piyo. Enjoy the toeless because solid socks tug on my toes too much so these let my toes breathe while working out.
customer_reviews.author: hayuf

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable and sure do the job of keeping g me steady on the mat.
customer_reviews.author: jsclady

customer_reviews.title: ... sometimes from the different foot locks so these are perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I use them for Aerial Hoop (Lyra) and you need to use your toes to grip sometimes but the top of your foot gets sore sometimes from the different foot locks so these are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Mallory L.

customer_reviews.title: Fit my feet very well. Didnt slide at all ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit my feet very well. Didnt slide at all at yoga. Just wish they didn't slide a but off towards my toes
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Wives are hard to buy for
customer_reviews.text: My wife didn't like them, but then she is hard to please when it comes to socks. She said the toe holes squeezed too tightly when she did the more aggressive yoga maneuvers. She also felt like the floor grip was no better than bare feet. Oh well, I tried!
customer_reviews.author: M. Crandall

customer_reviews.title: these are great!
customer_reviews.text: I can see what people mean about the in between toe parts hurting a bit but otherwise, these are great!
customer_reviews.author: Chinchillas

customer_reviews.title: Gaiam Toeless Grippy Yoga Socks
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. I saw them on another website and they were much more expensive. I actually use these as bedtime socks and put cream on before I put them on. I prefer having my toes out. They work really well and are well made.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha  Summers

customer_reviews.title: Wore once, not sure if I will wear again
customer_reviews.text: They aren't very comfortable and were tedious to put on. I was hoping to have something that would have grip and keep my feet a little warmer in the winter I ended up taking them off about halfway thru my yoga class. Haven't worn them since.
customer_reviews.author: CalicoChloe

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought these yoga socks to bring on a trip in the hopes that I could practice yoga in my hotel room and avoid lugging my mat around the UK. Unfortunately, while the socks did a good job gripping the floor, my feet were sliding inside the socks. It didn't work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for yoga classes
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I like to wear these at the gym when I'm attending yoga classes. They fit like a glove, protect my feet from the dirty floor, and provide excellent traction. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: Great grip
customer_reviews.text: I love this yoga socks. The grip is great. Even on wood floor without a mat, I can stretch without slipping. I highly recommend this socks.
customer_reviews.author: es91611

customer_reviews.title: love these for yoga
customer_reviews.text: I love these yoga socks they wash well and Ive had a pair for over 1 year. Just a little hard for me to get on because my toes are curled from arthritis but in the end they keep my toes straight. They are definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks!
customer_reviews.text: Just started doing Pilates. Had to buy a pair of toesox just before class, which I love. But too expensive. Found these on amazon. I like them just as much. They look identical and I don't care of the color or design on them, so I bought 4 of the same blue. They fit perfectly and do the job the same.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Constantin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amount of non slip is just right fit is good
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Banishes fear of slipping
customer_reviews.text: Unlike my earlier yoga Sox which shifted on my feet during standing postures, these gave secure, comfortable footing, allowing me to concentrate on correct form.
customer_reviews.author: Jan W.

customer_reviews.title: Better than barefoot
customer_reviews.text: I don't like wearing athletic shoes for floor exercises, but don't like to go barefoot and regular socks are slippery. These serve the purpose nicely.
customer_reviews.author: GardenGirl

product_meta.title: Gaiam Yoga Socks - Toeless Grippy Non Slip Sticky Grip Accessories for Women & Men
feature_bullets: Machine wash cold with similar colors. Gentle cycle, mild detergent. Do not bleach. tumble dry low. Do not iron.
TOELESS TRACTION: Open-toe design allows for a better tactile feel and balance
HYGENIC ALTERNATIVE TO BARE FEET: Protects feet from exposure to foot fungus while the sock also prevents feet from excess sweat and moisture for a superior grip in all conditions

USE WITH OR WITHOUT YOGA MAT: A great option for travel to toss in an overnight or carry-on bag or as a yoga mat substitute when a mat is out of reach - Silicone grips provide a non-slip grip anytime, anywhere, especially in absence of a mat
MULTI-PURPOSE: Ideal for Standard and Hot Yoga, Pilates, Barre, Ballet or even just around the house when you require some added grip and stability
Small/Medium (One Size Fits Most) - Women's Shoe 5-10 / Men's Shoe 4-9
